meanings.definition: Creating or performing spontaneously without preparation.
meanings.sent1: The improvising musician played a beautiful tune on the spot.
meanings.sent2: She is known for her improvising skills during live performances.
meanings.sent3: The improvising chef whipped up a delicious meal with whatever ingredients were left.
meanings.sent4: His improvising artistry painted the canvas with vibrant colors of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The improvising dancer moved gracefully to the music, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: Making something up as one goes along.
meanings.sent1: He enjoys improvising stories for his children at bedtime.
meanings.sent2: They were improvising a plan to escape from the locked room.
meanings.sent3: The students were improvising excuses for not completing their homework.
meanings.sent4: She was improvising a melody on her guitar, lost in the music.
meanings.sent5: The detective was improvising a cover story to deceive the suspect.

meanings.definition: Ad-libbing or making do with what is available.
meanings.sent1: They were improvising a makeshift shelter using branches and leaves.
meanings.sent2: The actor was improvising lines when he forgot his script on stage.
meanings.sent3: She was improvising a Halloween costume with old clothes and accessories.
meanings.sent4: The team was improvising strategies to win the game with limited time.
meanings.sent5: He was improvising a speech with cue cards, trying to remember the key points.
